intro: Pimpinella ranunculifolia, commonly known as the lesser cow-weed, is a biennial or short-lived perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves that are deeply lobed. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from May to July. Its fruits are dry, three-lobed follicles that release tiny seeds when mature. Pimpinella ranunculifolia is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows.
